 🧡 Enjoying, developing, and having fun at work is important, but of course, we also need to be a secure employer. We naturally offer occupational pensions, parental pay, and insurance for our employees.
 



  





 🧡 We have an open, colorful, and fresh office on Klarabergsviadukten in Stockholm. With the Central Station right next door, you can easily get here by public transport or bicycle.

title: Corporate Communications Manager to St1
description:
**Are you looking for a career move that makes you a part of driving the energy transition?** 
**Then you should take this opportunity and apply for this exciting role at St1.**
 We are looking for a Corporate Communications Manager to our Corporate Communications team.
   

  

 The main purpose of the Corporate Communications Manager role is to take responsibility of both the internal as the external communication work to share the actions we are taking to drive the energy transition with the aim to move us towards our vision to be the leading producer and seller of CO2 aware energy. On this journey utilize the St1 Brand platform as base and include all the different areas in our value chains to build the St1 story. All in all with the purpose, in collaboration with the Marketing team, to build the St1 brand stronger.
   

  

**Your Main Responsibilities Will Be**
* Contribute to the Group communication strategy work
* Supporting the St1 Group in identifying and fulfilling communications needs along all the value chains. From our production facilities to the end customer
* Actively participate in strategic and cross-functional project teams, contributing to their success through proactive and professional communication
* Media relations, proactive and reactive
* Develop, update and moderation of our own communication channels (e.g. Intranet, Website, Linkedin, Townhalls).
* The role has special responsibility for the Communication work in Sweden - St1 Sverige and St1 Refinery


**Requirements**
* Several years’ experience in demanding communications tasks
* Ability to be a partner to business in delivering the results
* Excellent written and oral communication skills in Swedish and English; impactful messaging, ability to convert complicated matters into understandable catchy messages
* Ability to engage and lead people without formal leadership role
* Digital knowledge and skills
* Excellent co-operation skills
* Experience in Sustainability communications is an advantage
* Experience in the energy sector and international organizations is an advantage
* You will report to the Head of Brands, Communication and Strategic Marketing and be based at our Stockholm office next to Bromma Blocks


**About St1 Nordic Oy**
 St1 Nordic Oy is an energy group whose vision is to be the leading producer and seller of CO2-aware energy. The Group researches and develops economically viable and environmentally sustainable energy solutions. St1 focuses on fuels marketing activities, oil refining, and renewable energy solutions such as waste-based advanced biofuels and industrial wind power. The Group has 1290 St1 and Shell branded retail stations and gas filling points in Finland, Sweden, and Norway. Headquartered in Helsinki, St1 currently employs more than 1200 people. Visit us at www.st1.com.
   

  

**Application**
 St1 is working with Lagotto Executive Search & Interim in this recruitment process. If you have any questions regarding this specific role, please contact senior consultants Christos Voglis christos.voglis@lagottosearch.se or ulrika.kjellberg@lagottosearch.se, Interviews and selection will take place in August. Please register your interest in the role before Aug 30 .
   

  

**About Lagotto Executive Search & Interim**
*Our clients can count on an engaged and agile partner with a thorough understanding of both their business and their organization. We build long-term relationships, continually acquiring knowledge and are up to date when it comes to understanding both the current and emerging challenges within our sector.*
*We boast extensive experience within strategic competence development at both group and individual levels. We recruit for potential and think long-term.*
*In our continual endeavour to sharpen and broaden our offering, we remain updated and abreast of developments relevant to our clients, branch and areas of expertise.*
*By following and contributing to current research within HR, we have a solid understanding of the prevailing trends relating to digitalisation, organisational development and leadership. Follow us on Linkedin to be part of our network - and share the insight.*
*Lagotto is a a wholly owned subsidiary of Amendo Group, delivering talent solutions since 2001. Read more about us at* 
*lagottosearch.se*

title: Enterprise Account Executive - Red Hat Sales (Stockholm Office, Sweden)
description:
The Red Hat Enterprise Sales team is looking for an Enterprise Account Executive to join us in Sweden. In this role, you will be responsible for retaining and growing sales within enterprise accounts within various verticals, helping our customers and partners make business and IT transformations using Red Hat services and solutions. As an Enterprise Account Executive, you will gain an understanding of our customers’ processes, needs, and challenges while promoting the value of Red Hat’s solutions and how they can deliver value to the customer.
   

  

 What you will bring
   

  

* Deliver on the account strategy to increase performance and customer success in key accounts, retaining and growing bookings through strategic account planning
* Translate Red Hat’s sales strategy into a relevant account-level strategy for each customer
* Apply knowledge of use cases and Red Hat’s strategic offering value proposition to identify and deliver opportunities to increase upsell, cross-sell, and renewals across the Red Hat portfolio while increasing presence within accounts
* Coordinate Solution Architects, specialist teams, Customer Success team, and industry experts to align Red Hat use cases to customer needs, guiding end-to-end sales to develop solutions that deliver business value
* Coordinate support from Solutions Architects, Sales Specialists and industry experts to guide end-to-end sales and deliver customer value
* Cultivate relationships across customer organizations to position Red Hat as a strategic partner to their business
* Collaborate with the Customer Success team to co-develop Success and Growth Plans, understanding how the customer derives value from Red Hat’s solutions to support expansion and retention and ensure that Red Hat meets or exceeds the customer’s success criteria
* Engage partners to strengthen Red Hat’s customer value proposition


 What you will do
   

  

* Excellent leadership and communication skills with ability to engage a diverse set of stakeholders in a matrixed organization and increase accountability within the account team
* Strategic orientation and value engineering skills to position and sell solutions to meet the customers’ needs and build business cases around ROI and total cost of ownership (TCO)
* Excellent understanding of customers’ business, industry trends, competitive landscape, and Red Hat differentiators and value proposition
* English and Swedish language skills
* Willingness to travel across Sweden, mostly Stockholm area


**About Red Hat**
 Red Hat is the world’s leading provider of enterprise open source software solutions, using a community-powered approach to deliver high-performing Linux, cloud, container, and Kubernetes technologies. Spread across 40+ countries, our associates have the flexibility to choose the work environment that suits their needs from in-office to fully remote to office-flex. Red Hatters are encouraged to bring their best ideas, no matter their title or tenure. We're a leader in open source because of our open and inclusive environment. We hire creative, passionate people ready to contribute their ideas, help solve complex problems, and make an impact. Opportunities are open. Join us.
   

  

**Diversity, Equity & Inclusion at Red Hat**
 Red Hat’s culture is built on the open source principles of transparency, collaboration, and inclusion, where the best ideas can come from anywhere and anyone. When this is realized, it empowers people from diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences to come together to share ideas, challenge the status quo, and drive innovation. Our aspiration is that everyone experiences this culture with equal opportunity and access, and that all voices are not only heard but also celebrated. We hope you will join our celebration, and we welcome and encourage applicants from all the beautiful dimensions of diversity that compose our global village.
   

  

**Equal Opportunity Policy (EEO)**
 Red Hat is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer. We review applications for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, veteran status, genetic information, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, or any other basis prohibited by law.
   

  

 Red Hat does not seek or accept unsolicited resumes or CVs from recruitment agencies. We are not responsible for, and will not pay, any fees, commissions, or any other payment related to unsolicited resumes or CVs except as required in a written contract between Red Hat and the recruitment agency or party requesting payment of a fee.
   

  

 Red Hat supports individuals with disabilities and provides reasonable accommodations to job applicants. If you need assistance completing our online job application, email application-assistance@redhat.com. General inquiries, such as those regarding the status of a job application, will not receive a reply.

title: Product Specialist SW and Digitalization
description:
**Product Specialist SW & Digitalization – OT-Security**
 Are you passionate about developing and securing our digital products for the dairy industry? Do you have experience in product management and operational technology (OT) security? If so, you might be the person we are looking for!
   

  

 DeLaval is a global leader in dairy farming solutions, with a vision to make sustainable food production possible. We have more than 130 years of experience in developing and delivering products and services that help farmers improve animal welfare, milk quality, and productivity. We operate in more than 100 countries and have over 4,500 employees worldwide.
   

  

 As a Product Specialist OT-security, you will be responsible for the OT- security aspects of our products, both in our product leadership areas and complementary products.
   

  

 You will together with the development organization define and implement security policies, standards, and best practices. A vital part of the role is to support our service and market organization worldwide regarding new practices in the OT/IT-security area. You will work closely with other product managers and market organization, as well as with external stakeholders such as customers, authorities, and industry bodies.
   

  

**To Be Successful In This Role, You Should Have**
* Excellent communication and presentation skills, both written and verbal, to be able to provide trainings etc.
* Good ability to listen and understand the customer /service technician’s requirements.
* Experience in OT-security area, preferably in the industrial or agricultural sector.
* At least three years of experience in SW product management, agile development, and/or stakeholder management.
* A degree in computer science, engineering, or a related field
* Knowledge of security frameworks, standards, and methodologies, such as ISO 27001, NIST, ISA/IEC 62443, etc is beneficial.
* Experience in security risk assessment, threat modelling, vulnerability management, and incident response is beneficial.
* Fluent in English, both written and spoken.


 As a Product Specialist OT-security, you will be part of the Real Time SW team within the Product Management and Development (PMD) Unit. The team manages the Real Time SW on the farm and work closely with SW dev organization and other parts of product management and market organization to define and develop future products and maintain our current SW. You will report to Product Area Manager RTSW and work from our office in either Tumba, Sweden or Wroclaw, Poland. Some travel may be required.
   

  

 If you are interested in joining our team, please apply online with your CV and cover letter at the latest 6 September. We look forward to hearing from you! If you have questions do not hesitate to contact recruiting manager Anneli Lidmar or HR Business Partner Ida Roman.

title: Time Management Super User
description:
Är du kunnig inom systemadministration och support? Är du en strukturerad, lösningsorienterad och kommunikativ person med hög servicenivå? Är du en person som brinner för effektiva processer och vill bidra till företagets ekonomiska framgång? Då kan detta vara tjänsten för dig!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder**
 På Travel Expense and Time Management arbetar vi i nära samverkan inom gruppen, men även tvärfunktionellt med Payroll, HR System och IT, för att nämna några.
   

  

 Som Super User är du en viktig del av ett engagerat team som bl.a. hjälper våra kunder att tidrapportera korrekt, validera lönefiler, skapa körschema, bygga scheman, bevaka integrationer m.m. Supportfunktionen är i en intensiv uppstartsfas vilket innebär att du är med och påverkar uppbyggnaden av den blivande förvaltningen och supportorganisation. Du behöver därför snabbt kunna sätta dig in i arbetet för att kunna hjälpa Scanias medarbetare och chefer ute i verksamheten, samt hantera det webbaserade tidsystemet ProMark.
   

  

 Du tillhör en kultur som lägger stort fokus på service, där ett professionellt bemötande och hög tillgänglighet är ledord för oss. Arbete med ständiga förbättringar genomsyrar vår vardag, liksom fokus på egen kompetensutveckling. Scania erbjuder även ett flexibelt arbetssätt vilket innebär att vi arbetar hemifrån i viss utsträckning.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter**
 Din huvudsakliga uppgift är att tillsammans med dina kollegor, supportera Scanias svenska enheter i tidrapporteringssystemet ProMark. Som Super User har du en koordinerande roll där du ansvarar för uppgifter av olika komplexitet och omfattning. Det innebär bl.a. att lösa inkommande ärenden till supporten som 2:nd line support, övervaka och hantera felloggar för tidssystemet, genomföra aktiviteter enligt satt körschema och aktivt delta i förbättringsarbeten. Du hjälper och guidar dina Scaniakollegor i hur tidssystemet fungerar samt vilka ramverk som gäller. I arbetet ingår även att besvara frågor och guida i ProMark både genom ärendehanteringssystem och via telefon. Vi arbetar med ständiga förbättringar och effektiviseringar av våra processer och systemadministrativa uppgifter
   

  

**Din profil**
 Vi söker en driven, kommunikativ och strukturerad person med stark servicekänsla och stort intresse för system.
   

  

 För att uppfylla kraven för rollen behöver du ha en eftergymnasial utbildning inom lön och/eller minst 2 års erfarenhet av tidsrapporteringssystem. Ha goda kunskaper inom teknisk support, samt har tidigare erfarenhet från arbete inom servicesektorn. Du kommunicerar obehindrat både på svenska och engelska.
   

  

 Du har ett stort intresse för digitala verktyg och har lätt för att sätta dig in i processer och hitta förbättringar och lösningar av datat vi arbetar med. Rollen kräver kunskap i både system och applikation och en fördel är att du har vana och förståelse att utveckla och kravställa processer och systemstöd.
   

  

 Vi ser det som en förutsättning för denna roll att du är en lagspelare med ett stort engagemang för ditt uppdrag.
   

  

 Meriterande är:
   

  

  

* Högskoleutbildning
* Mycket goda kunskaper i Microsoft Office paketet
* Erfarenhet inom projektledning och koordinering
* Kunskaper om Scanias processer och arbetssätt


**Om oss**
 Gruppen Travel Expense and Time Management ingår i avdelningen för Payroll, vilket är en av fem avdelningar inom People Business Service & Support, Sverige. Inom Payroll finns det tre team: Travel Expense and Time Management, Payroll 1 och Payroll 2 och tillsammans är vi idag ca 25 medarbetare. Travel Expense and Time Management består av sju personer varav fyra av medarbetarna supporterar Travel Expense och resterande supporterar Time Management. Vi har en härlig stämning i gruppen och är en bra mix av personligheter, erfarenhet och kompetens som vi gärna delar med oss utav. Vi ställer såklart upp och stöttar varandra när det behövs.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Tycker du att detta låter intressant, skicka gärna in din ansökan innehållande personligt brev och CV så snart som möjligt, dock senast 2024-08-29
   

  

 Vid eventuella frågor, kontakta rekryterande chef, Åsa Forsell Johansson via mejl: asa.forsell.johansson@scania.com
   

  

 En bakgrundskontroll kan komma att genomföras för denna tjänst

title: Innovation & Process Analyst SM&P
description:
TUI Group is the world’s number one integrated tourism business. Within TUI Group, TUI Airline regroups all airline activities across UK, Nordics, Belgium, The Netherlands, Germany, Spain, Morocco, France, and the Dutch Antilles. The Supplier Management & Procurement (SM&P) team plays a key commercial role in TUI Airline, optimising value in all aviation contracts.
   

  

 As
 **Innovation & Process Analyst** 
 you will take a critical role in managing and developing all operational business and procurement data and activities within SM&P. You will develop reporting outputs that will allow for data-driven procurement and supplier management, and these reports will be used to influence the actions of senior managers.
   

  

 You will challenge suppliers, as well as the business with innovative improvements. You will identify and project manage new value adding procurement data processes. In this role you will develop and leverage an excellent network, cooperate with internal and external stakeholders. You will stay current and be the SM&P expert on business developments.
   

  

 In this role, you’ll report to the
 **Senior Manager of Business Performance & Development** 
 .
   

  

**About The Role**
* You will play a critical part in developing and managing a reliable, structured, effective and knowledgeable competence centre within SM&P for all related operational business and procurement data and activities/analysis. You will act as SM&P business partner and drive innovation towards SM&P colleagues and business functions by advising and recommending to ensure proper follow-up of long-term supplier performance.
+ By working with IT in a Business Intelligence (BI) environment, you will lead the automation and digitalization of data collection for the SM&P area.
+ You will project manage the setup of SM&P BI systems and define interfaces/visualisations and identify and describe SM&P data requirements and set targets for operational data to support procurement projects and strategy, supplier KPI’s and to monitor long-term supplier performance and the relevant KPI’s that are in line with SM&P’s and the company’s strategic vision.
+ You will evaluate data quality and test correctness of data, monitor results make recommendations to the team and perform pro-active and predictive analysis and forecasts as well as constantly consider any implications and further data and analysis that may be required.

* By working with SM&P colleagues, you will support procurement projects by providing requested data, or setup and manage a project to obtain requested data, if it is not yet centrally available. Joining procurement specialists or managers on selected visits/meetings with suppliers or stakeholders to discuss specific performance KPI’s and be the subject expert when providing guidance on definition; how KPI’s will/can be tracked, etc. Based on the KPI data collected you will provide insights to influence senior decision makers.
+ You will manage compliance and accuracy in terms of (supplier) operational business data input by confirming with business owners and stakeholders the definition and source of information; determine how KPI’s will be tracked and be familiar with the tools used. As part of the supplier management programme, you will also work closely with suppliers to obtain KPI data.
+ You will take ownership of supplier operational business data databases, reporting and presentations through the validation and coordination of supplier performance reports across the different categories. You will ensure consistency in reporting across different areas of responsibility and determine, together with business owners and SM&P colleagues, the root cause of potential performance issues and investigate an appropriate remedy.

* You will be required to develop advanced knowledge of the insurance claims process for which you will co-ordinate as subject matter expert on behalf of TUI Airlines. You will need to manage stakeholders (such as SM&P, the TUI Airlines, TUI Group Insurance team, Suppliers and TUI insurance broker, finance, legal, etc) as well as regularly review the claim process, provide training on this process, improve efficiency and make sure you maintain an overview of claims, status, etc. across all TUI Airlines.
* Through (self) auditing you will work with the SM&P team members to evaluate working in accordance with SM&P processes and procedures and TUI Group policies. You present your advice and recommendations regarding the outcome of the audit to senior managers.
* You take ownership of economic databases, reporting and presentations including validation, coordination and presentation of saving reports of all procurement activities/projects and ensure consistency in reporting across different areas of responsibility. You will collect, consolidate, interpret and communicate/present relevant economic parameters or data (market, countries, suppliers, geopolitics) that may impact department goals, decision making or contract projects/closures.
* You will support the Senior Manager of BPD as a business partner towards the finance team and will also contribute your expertise towards SM&P colleagues by providing ongoing review and support to SM&P team members during procurement projects, including financial analysis of proposals. You will support and review initial financial analysis for submission to relevant internal stakeholders and perform spend analysis, to continuously detect and materialize saving opportunities as part of a strategic approach and planning. This will include supporting the Business Case process. When required, you will join SM&P team members on selected visits/meetings with suppliers or stakeholders to safeguard the economic/financial aspects, of any projects.
* You will develop and leverage an excellent network and cooperation with internal (SM&P colleagues, operational functions, Aviation IT, etc.) and external (suppliers, etc.) stakeholders, so as to ensure the best input and output within your scope. Ensure that SM&P maintains industry best practice as well as knowledge of business/supplier developments through relevant reading, networking, meetings or attending conferences/workshops. Ensure you are acting according to TUI values and relevant finance/procurement policies and overlook the function/department for such overall compliance as well.


**About You**
* Have at least a bachelor degree, preferably master’s degree in business management, economics, accounting, statistics, aviation or computer and information science
* At least three years of relevant experience. Financial or accounting experience is desirable
* Highly proficient in English, knowledge of other languages desirable but not essential
* Be business/commercially oriented and have a business/IT hybrid profile
* Experience of managing projects, planning delivery and coordinating the inputs from different stakeholders to achieve desired outcomes
* Experience working with senior level stakeholders, external stakeholders; able to influence behavior and opinions based on knowledge and experience
* Have strong numeric, analytical and problem-solving skills with eye for detail
* Have good PC skills with an advanced knowledge of Excel, Access, knowledge of Oracle and SQL is desired but not essential
* Able to work, always innovating, in a rapidly change environment, prioritising accordingly
* Be self-motivated to get things done, take initiative
* Able to easily develop a strong network of contacts throughout the business and industry, gaining the support and commitment of key players to key projects
* Experience with at least one of the aviation operational categories (Engineering & Maintenance, Airline Operations, Customer Operations, etc.) is desired but not essential
* Experience as business intelligence analyst is desired but not essential
* Ability to identify and understand key drivers in any scenario
* Ability to challenge assumptions, to ask critical questions and to think out of the box
* Evidence of making decisions & influencing others to deliver to high standards in a fast-moving operational environment
* Effective communication and reporting skills, able to tailor messaging for different stakeholders
* Good sense of commercial acumen & financial awareness
* Able to travel regularly to meet with suppliers and internal stakeholders, for example
* Able to work according to TUI values and procurement policies


**About Our Offer**
* Working in the leading global tourism group: We stand for intercultural cooperation and offer the opportunity to work in international projects and teams.
* Mobile working, flexible working hours and working from abroad: We believe that work is something you do, not where you go.
* Development and career opportunities: We promote the potential of our employees with a wide range of (digital) training opportunities and international career opportunities.
* Personal benefits: We offer attractive remuneration, generous travel benefits, extensive health & wellbeing offers and much more.


 We love to see your uniqueness shine through and inspire the future of travel. If you would like to read more about what Diversity & Inclusion means to us simply visit Our DNA
   

  

 If you require any further information regarding this opportunity, please email careers@tui.co.uk
   

  

 We really value your interest in TUI and will be back in touch with you shortly after the application closing date.

title: EDD-administratör till storbank!
description:
Administratör
   

  

 EDD-administratör till storbank!
   

  

 Vi söker nu flera konsulter för ett uppdrag inom EDD (Enhanced Due Diligence) hos en storbank i Stockholm. Banken har en backlog men ärenden som du som konsult kommer att arbeta med. Du kommer att granska kunder, analysera risker och slutföra EDD-processen för att minska eftersläpningen och säkerställa regelverk och lagkrav efterföljs.
   

  

 Konsultuppdraget är med placering hos banken i centrala Stockholm, är på heltid och planeras starta under september månad. Uppdraget planerad pågå till mitten av maj 2025.
   

  

 Om tjänsten
   

  

 Du som konsult kommer att granska och analysera transaktionsmönster baserat på en inlämnad SAR, kontakta kunder via telefon och säkra meddelanden samt fatta ett beslut om huruvida de ska acceptera den finansiella brottsrisk som är associerad med kunden. Du kommer också ta hand om alla administrativa uppgifter relaterade till detta arbete för att uppdatera EDD (Enhanced Due Diligence).
   

  

 Vem är du?
   

  

 Vi ser att du som köper rollen har/är:
   

  

* IT-kunskaper (Microsoft 365)
* Erfarenhet av informationsinsamling från äldre system
* Erfarenhet av informationsanalys
* Kundserviceerfarenhet (både personligen och skriftligt)
* Kunskap om kundbeteende och produkter inom den svenska banksektorn
* En strukturerad arbetsmetod
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska


 Om verksamheten
   

  

 Konsultrollen passar dig som på kort tid vill skaffa dig bred erfarenhet. Vi erbjuder dig chansen att arbeta på populära arbetsplatser med välkända varumärken där du kan utveckla din kompetens och bredda ditt CV. Du kommer att trivas som konsult om du söker en värld av spännande uppdrag och nya kontaktnät. Vid din sida har du din konsultchef som agerar bollplank och stöttar dig i att lyckas på dina uppdrag. Vi vill att du ska må bra och trivas med oss på Poolia. Därför erbjuder vi dig friskvårdsbidrag, rabatter på olika träningsanläggningar och ordnar regelbundet sociala aktiviteter. Självklart omfattas din anställning på Poolia av kollektivavtal, försäkringar, tjänstepension samt företagshälsovård.

title: Inköpschef (Interim)
description:
Vill du arbeta i framkant inom svensk industri och näringsliv och utvecklas både som person och i professionen? Vi söker dig som vill arbeta som anställd konsult eller som underkonsult i denna roll.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
**Huvudsakliga Arbetsuppgifter i Rollen Är Att**
* ansvara för hela inköpsprocessen
* driva verksamhets- och processutveckling inom inköpsområdet mot uppsatta mål
* utforma och implementera inköpsstrategier
* driva utveckling och styrning av leverantörsbas mot uppsatta mål
* leda inköpsavdelningens löpande arbete och ha personalansvar


**Kvalifikationer**
**Vi Söker Dig Som Har/är**
* akademisk examen eller annan likvärding eftergymasial utbildning
* hög IT-mognad, dvs. behärskar Office 365, affärssystem och andra system som är relevanta för rollen
* mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska i såväl tal som skrift


 Inom inköp vill vi att du har erfarenhet av:
   

  

* att ha verkat i rollen som inköpschef (med personalansvar) i minst 4 år
* strategiskt inköps- och upphandlingsarbete
* verksamhets- och processutveckling
* utveckla och implementera inköpsstrategier
* kategoristyrning
* leverantörsutveckling / Supplier Relationship Management, SRM
* förhandlingsvana
* avtalsskrivning


 Läs mer om kompetensnivåer på följande länk: https://www.addilon.se/konsult/kompetensnivaer/
   

  

**Personlighet**
 För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du är:
   

  

* kommunikativ
* initiativtagande
* strukturerad
* analytisk


 Läs mer om kompetensnivåer på följande länk: https://www.addilon.se/konsult/kompetensnivaer/
   

  

**Vi erbjuder**
 Som konsult hos oss får möjlighet att arbeta hos kunder som ligger i framkant inom svensk industri och näringsliv. Uppdragen anpassas för att nivån ligga i linje med kundens förväntningar och vara så utvecklande och stimulerande som möjligt. Till din hjälp kommer du att ha många duktiga kollegor och ett aktivt erfarenhetsutbyte. Vi
 **transformerar karriärer och bygger framgångsrika företag** 
 genom att alltid utgå från våra värderingar.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Din ansökan (CV och personligt brev) skickar du in snarast via länken nedan. Urval sker löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan ansökningstiden gått ut. Frågor om tjänsten besvaras för dig som går vidare till intervju.
   

  

 För att arbeta som konsult hos oss krävs det att du:
   

  

* Delar våra värderingar
* Är etablerad i ditt yrke
* Har relevant erfarenhet för uppdraget
* Gärna har erfarenhet från olika roller och olika branscher


 Vissa av våra uppdrag omfattas av försvarssekretess. Det innebär att du behöver ha svenskt medborgarskap samt genomgå och godkännas i en säkerhetsprövning.
   

  

**Om Addilon**
 Rekrytering och uthyrning av rätt chefer och specialister inom främst teknik, försäljning, inköp och logistik i Stockholm, Göteborg, Mälardalen, Helsingfors, Köpenhamn, Oslo och Chicago.
   

  

**Följ Oss På**
 LinkedIn | Facebook | Instagram
   

  

 Vi undanber oss vänligt men bestämt direktkontakt med försäljare av ytterligare jobbannonser, kandidater etc.

title: Head Planning Department
description:
**ValueOne is looking for a Head of Forecasting, Planning & Customer Order Management for a consultant assignment at our customer’s premises north of Stockholm. The assignment must be filled as soon as possible and lasts for about six months.** 




  





*ValueOne are specialists in supply chain management, purchasing, and logistics. We offer our customers services in three business areas: interim logistics and procurement consultants, recruitment of buyers and logisticians, as well as development of our customers’ supply chain operations in terms of strategies, models, methods, processes, structure, and competence.* 




*We can offer a variety of assignments at all levels within Supply Chain Management. As a consultant at ValueOne, you are part of a professional and enterprising team consisting of the leading consultants in purchasing and logistics. If you choose to join our team, you are offered:* 



* *A market salary, which you can influence yourself.*
* *Occupational pension.*
* *Health and care insurance.*
* *Health care allowance.*
* *Personal coaching and career advice.*
* *Network meetings with competent colleagues and Supply Chain professionals through recurring events and lectures.*
* *Competence development through world-leading individually tailored education and courses in Supply Chain thanks to our partnership with CIPS (www.cips.org).*



  





**The role** 




 As the Head of Forecasting, Planning & Customer Order Management your primary responsibility will be to manage and optimize the forecasting, planning, and order management processes. This involves participating in the S&OP (Sales & Operations Planning) process to create and manage the Master Production Schedule, monitoring and updating forecasts for accessories, and analyzing data to optimize production planning. You will also ensure that customer orders are managed efficiently, from registration to delivery, while maintaining high levels of customer satisfaction. Additionally, you will lead a team, ensuring they are well-trained and compliant, and work collaboratively with other functions to drive continuous improvements across the supply chain.
 



  





**Experience and competencies** 




 We are looking for a candidate with a Bachelor’s degree in Supply Chain Management, Operations, Business Administration, or a related field, although a Master’s degree is advantageous. You should have at least 7-10 years of experience in forecasting, planning, and order management, preferably within a manufacturing environment. Leadership experience is crucial, as you will be responsible for developing and guiding your team to success. We expect you to be fluent in English and Swedish in oral and writing. The role demands strong analytical skills, with the ability to interpret data and optimize complex processes. Experience in using IT systems for planning and order management is essential. You should also have a proven track record of driving continuous improvement initiatives and possess excellent communication skills for effective collaboration across departments.
 



  





**Application** 




 We look forward to receiving your application. Feel free to contact Frank Hemgren at +46 70 748 18 91 or 010 332 29 20 with any questions regarding the listed position. Please note that to apply for this position you need to be an EU citizen or have a valid Swedish working permit.

title: Researcher within automotive corrosion
description:
*Do you have experience in atmospheric corrosion in various applications? Do you enjoy working on both longer projects and short assignments, all of which focus on a demand-driven technology development linked to societal and industrial challenges in both Sweden and internationally? Do you see it as motivating to be able to take your own initiative to develop a segment, carry out research projects and customer assignments? Then RISE has an interesting job for you!*
**About Us**
 The Corrosion department of RISE offers an attractive workplace as one of Europe's leading corrosion research players with the mission to create Swedish industrial benefit through company-wide research. We are located in Kista north of Stockholm where we have large modern premises, as well as in Borås. In France, we have a wholly owned subsidiary focused on corrosion research.
   

  

**About The Position**
 You will be working as Researcher in the corrosion department. You will work in several projects related to automotive corrosion, surface treatment and corrosion testing. You will be working with a range of different research and development projects as well as carrying out shorter industrial consultancy projects regarding corrosion of metallic materials. You will work closely with our industrial clients as well as other research entities, in Sweden but also internationally. You will be given an independent role while being part of a research team with close collaboration with your colleagues.
   

  

 Placement: Kista
   

  

**Who are you?**
 You have a university degree within material science, chemistry or engineering. You have a good theoretical understanding as well as interest and comprehension for laboratory work. We prioritise our customers and colleagues, so you should have a good ability to create working relationships with both. The job involves a lot of customer contact and therefore demands that you can express yourself clearly in both Swedish and English, both speaking and writing.
   

  

 As a person you are committed and driven, enjoy a high tempo environment and see solutions and opportunities rather than problems. You are well organised and have an interest in helping create new business and projects but also an ability to further develop existing ones.
   

  

**Are we right for each other?**
 We can't promise you a simple job, but we can offer you many committed and enthusiastic colleagues and some exciting industrial and societal challenges. You will work in a dynamic environment that gives you development opportunities both professionally and personally. At RISE, we want you to succeed and feel good, because together with your colleagues you contribute to a sustainable future and to securing a leading position for Swedish industry and research globally.
   

  

**Welcome with your application!**
 For more information about the position, please contact Johan Tidblad, Unit manager, tel: +46 73 512 56 82, johan.tidblad@ri.se. Please note that we do not accept applications by email. Last day to apply is 25th of August.
   

  

 Our union representative are Ulf Nordberg, SACO, 010-516 69 59 och Linda Ikatti, Unionen, 010-516 51 61.

title: Sustainability Director
description:
*At Polarium Sustainability is a key contributor to our success. We are now hiring a Sustainability Director to our HQ in Stockholm. As a Sustainability Director you will have a transformative role as you take lead on developing and driving our sustainability strategy and goals. Do you want to create a smart and sustainable future?* 
*Come and join our team and get the opportunity to drive Polarium’s Sustainability ambitions.* 




  





**About the job** 




 We are looking for a Sustainability Director to lead the implementation of our sustainability strategy. In this role you will develop our sustainability strategy and goals. You will also drive change and continuous improvement within our sustainability work. You will work with both analytical and tactical tasks as well as strategic elements to further improve Polarium’s sustainability performance. Your work will be a key contributor for Polarium to reach our high ambitions and to fulfill the expectations not least from our customers. The position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.
 



  





**You have** 



* At least 8 years of experience of leading sustainability strategy work.
* A proven track record of setting sustainability targets and driving implementation across functions and geographies at a manufacturing company.
* Demonstrated ability of building structure and processes related to climate impact analysis and reporting.
* Develop, implement, and lead the company’s sustainability strategy, ensuring alignment with overall business objectives and industry standards.
* Practical experience from working with GHG accounting (GHG Protocol), disclosing progress to CDP, CSRD reporting and double materiality assessments. Experience from LCA/Carbon Footprint calculations is beneficial.
* A hands-on approach to working and enjoy working cross-functionally to achieve common goal.
* Proven project management skills, preferably with experience from working in an international organization, with multiple stakeholders and in cross-functional environments.
* Good understanding of trends and disclosure regulations related to sustainability and the ability to plan for future requirements.
* Analytical mindset with the ability to tackle complex issues in a structured and logical way.
* Excellent and clear communication skills in both written and oral English.



  





**You will** 



* Lead Polarium’s climate strategy and targets.
* Support the organization in identifying actions, targets and KPIs that improve our sustainability performance.
* Develop and implement CDP and CSRD reporting.
* Develop and implement climate risk analysis.
* Be responsible for managing, ensuring high quality of, and developing Polarium’s climate impact calculations.
* Further develop our roadmap towards net zero.
* Continuously communicate with various stekeholders on our sustainability work, results, and actions.
* Participate in strategic projects across functions and teams to leverage Polarium’s sustainability ambitions.



  





**About you** 




 You have a passion for sustainability and a strong drive to create real impact. You will be joining a team of ambitious people who think big, take charge and work together as one team to achieve big things.
 



  





 You will ensure that we are delivering on our values and our mission – to enable endless energy. You are strongly goal oriented and have a passion for contributing to a company driving and enabling the transition to a sustainable energy system. In your role you will drive the Sustainability strategy formulation and implementation.
 



  





**What’s in it for you?** 




 We offer a challenging position in an open, friendly international environment where we help each other to develop and create value, as we are one. Your work and mind-set will have a true impact on Polarium’s future success and we encourage you to take charge. Every day, we think big for a smarter and more sustainable future – let’s do it together.
 



  





**We offer** 



* Maximized wellness contribution
* Five flexibility days
* Pension and health insurance



  





**Energize your career** 




 We believe an inclusive work environment is what will boost our employees’ success. An open mindset is what charges our innovation and creativity. We believe that there’s always one more thing to learn, one new thing to invent, and one more product to develop to make energy systems around the world greener and more efficient. Come join our team and get the opportunity to engineer the future!
 



  





**Application** 




 Please send us your application through the application button (compliant with GDPR). To apply you need to have a work permit in Sweden. Applications will be reviewed, and interviews held continuously so don’t wait with submitting your application.
 



  





**Plug into Polarium** 




 We’ve enabled endless energy since 2015.
 



  





 Our frontier tech in energy storage systems has reached all over the world and transformed the renewable energy industry. We are 375 employees located in over 4 continents and counting. Our valuable diversity, creativity and top-class engineering is the code we use to unlock the most complex sustainability problems in energy.

title: Konsult inom området strategisk portföljstyrning
description:
**Hos På i Sverige AB kan du bidra till att bygga framtidens digitala offentliga sektor. Vi hjälper vår kunder att skapa en strategisk portföljstyrning för effektiv digitalisering/ verksamhetsutveckling.** 




  





**Välkommen till På i Sverige AB!** 




 Hos På i Sverige AB kan du bidra till att bygga framtidens digitala offentliga sektor. Samhällets utmaningar är större än någonsin och vi vill bidra till kloka prioriteringar på gott underlag, en god samverkan och rätt användning av medarbetares och chefers tid och kraft. Vi hjälper våra kunder att styra mot sina mål på ett sätt som överbryggar interna gränser och där alla medarbetare och chefer som har en del i digitaliseringen har ett bra samarbete.
 



  





 Våra verktyg och metoder för att åstadkomma det är
 



  




* Hög förmåga att lyssna, analysera och lära om kundens mål, verksamhet och kultur för att hitta de lösningar, det språk och den förändringstakt som ger mest effekt
* Ett synsätt som innebär att digitalisering är ett sätt att utveckla verksamhet och att engagemanget från ledning och verksamhetsansvariga är avgörande för framgång
* Bred och djup kunskap om styrning och samverkan generellt, där effekterna står i centrum
* Kunskap och erfarenhet av de modeller och metoder som finns inom digitalisering och styrning
* Ett kommunikativt förhållningssätt där lärande och dialog är lika viktigt som struktur.
* En god och beprövad struktur för tvärfunktionell samverkan i grunden. Pm3-modellen som vi äger och förvaltar är vårt ständiga verktyg för att analysera behov och införa förbättringar hos våra kunder.



  





 Vår kultur präglas av en äkta vilja att göra skillnad i våra uppdrag och för varandra. Vi tror starkt på att positiv energi, tillsammans med en hög förmåga att bygga relationer och rätt kompetens är parametrarna som skapar förutsättningar för förändring.
 



  





**Om tjänsten – arbetsuppgifterna** 




 Inom På finns många olika kompetenser. Vilken typ av uppdrag du hamnar i beror på dina tidigare erfarenheter och kunskaper, men också på hur du långsiktigt vill utvecklas.
 



  





 Du kan komma att delta i förändringsuppdrag där utmaningen är att antingen börja från noll och hjälpa kunden att få till en tvärfunktionell styrning och samverkan i sin organisation. Eller så kan utmaningen vara att de arbetssätt som finns hos kunden skaver och behöver justeras, med allt vad det innebär av analys, framtagande av handlingsplaner och förändringsledning.
 



  





 Om du har erfarenhet av objektledning eller förvaltningsledning kan du komma att hoppa in i ett operativt uppdrag i en befintlig styr- och samverkansstruktur, där du ingår i ett kundteam.
 



  





 Vi bedriver också utbildning, både i form av öppna kurser och som organisationsanpassade utbildningar. Utbildningsuppdrag är generellt sett ett vanligt inslag i tjänsten. I rollen som konsult hos oss är det naturligt att du tar ett säljansvar i de projekt du är involverad i vilket i praktiken betyder att du tillsammans med kunden utvecklar dina projekt till en långsiktig relation med ett tydligt värde för både kunden och På.
 



  





**Erfarenhet och kompetens** 




 Tidigare erfarenhet av att arbeta som konsult är starkt meriterande och du behöver ha en god förmåga att lyssna in kundens behov och tillsammans med kunden skapa en kundunik tillämpning av styrning. Du har erfarenhet, kunskap och intresse för hur olika typer av organisationer styrs utifrån olika förutsättningar.
 



  





 Du behöver också vara van vid och trivas med att tala inför grupp, entusiasmera och skapa engagemang i utbildningar eller workshops.
 



  





 Du behöver även på något sätt ha varit i tidigare kontakt med pm3 modellen.
 



  





 Erfarenhet från roller som t.ex., förändringsledare, processledare, processutvecklare, objektledare, förvaltningsledare, projektledare, IT-samordnare, IT-projektledare, IT-strateg, verksamhetsutvecklare inom relevant område eller utvecklingssamordnare är i kombination med konsult erfarenhet, klart meriterande.
 



  





**Personliga egenskaper** 




 Du är trygg i dig själv och med din kompetens och vill verkligen arbeta som konsult. Vidare är du nyfiken och intresserad av att sätta dig in i och förstå olika organisationers sammanhang. I konsultrollen behöver du kunna ta ansvar för den löpande utvecklingen i dina kunduppdrag och har en affärsmässig förståelse för vad det betyder. Samtidigt som du är strukturerad och uthållig har du förmåga att i konsultrollen vara flexibel och anpassningsbar. Vi är beroende av att samarbeta tätt med varandra inom företaget och det är därför viktigt för oss att du är prestigelös, vågar och vill bjuda lite på dig själv och har lika lätt för att samarbeta med andra som att arbeta självständigt.
 



  





**Vad kan På AB erbjuda dig?** 




  





**Ett stabilt och välrenommerat företag inom digitalisering och styrning** 



* På i Sverige AB har arbetat inom området styrning och samverkan i över 20 år. Bland annat genom att ständigt utveckla pm3-modellen för att den ska stödja organisationer i en tid då förändringstakten och komplexiteten är högre än någonsin.



  





**Ett innovativt och kundorienterat förhållningssätt** 



* Vårt förhållningssätt är att organisationsanpassning och flexibilitet, samt samordning med andra styrmodeller och ramverk är nyckeln till framgång.



  





**Samhällsviktiga uppdrag** 



* Våra uppdrag transformerar den offentliga sektorn mot en förenklad vardag för medborgare och effektiv användning av offentliga medel.



  





**Flexibilitet och balans mellan arbete och privatliv** 



* Flexibla arbetstider och stort fokus på kompetensutveckling ger dig möjlighet till balans mellan privatliv och arbete, oavsett var i livet just du befinner dig.



  





**Schyssta kollegor, förtroende och många skratt** 



* I vårt företag hjälps vi åt. Vi gillar att bryta idéer mot varandra och vi hittar alltid tid för att bolla en fråga om man kört fast. Vi har högt förtroende för varandras kompetens och erfarenhet och har väldigt kul när vi ses – i alla arbetets faser och på våra gemensamma utvecklingsdagar.



  





 Välkommen in med din ansökan!

title: SCE Strategic Engagement Lead - Benelux, Nordics and Baltics, SCE- BENELUX, NORDICS and BALTICS
description:
**Description**
 AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector.
   

  

 The AWS Global Support team interacts with leading companies and believes that world-class support is critical to customer success. AWS Support also partners with a global list of customers that are building mission-critical applications on top of AWS services.
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is looking for a strong Customer Engagements manager within AWS that is a seasoned leader who is able to manage the various critical phases of the cycle in conjunction with various AWS teams, including the Account Team and local leadership. This is a unique opportunity to engage with AWS customers on strategic opportunities, increase the growth of AWS, and to establish AWS as their key cloud technology provider.
   

  

 As a member of SCE, you will be responsible for managing the end to end Deal Cycle for strategic, large, complex or highly competitive deals. You will focus on earning trust with customers by creating actionable strategies, developing and shaping opportunities, and leading deal engagements through negotiations and closure. This highly visible role will own alignment with C-level executives, IT teams, and multiple lines of business to achieve business outcomes, increase the adoption of AWS services, and to enable private pricing, go-to-market, pan-Amazon, and other strategic relationships. You will work collaboratively to drive results by partnering with AWS customers, AWS field sales executives, and other internal stakeholders to empower our customers to evolve, address challenges, and to create innovative solutions.
   

  

 Strategy: This individual will work with the Account Team analyzing key corporate data (such as Corporate reports, Board Members, eco-system) related to the opportunity being supported, and ensure executive alignment and governance. The individual will be able to provide advice on the competitive situation and create an actionable strategy.
   

  

 Structuring: You will be able understand the business objectives and create a structure that maximizes the value of the opportunity and achieving business objectives.
   

  

 Communications: You will be experienced to advise on customer communications
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Responsible for inspiring and motivating a diverse team in concert with the field focused account manager.
* Act as trusted advisor to account teams.
* Brings thought leadership to market needs, generating competitive advantage on existing markets.
* Stays current and informed on all new market trends and campaigns, understanding their objectives and relevance, and applying them across the organization/region.
* Inspires and influences internal stakeholders, experts and other resources not under direct control, helping to remove obstacles and aiming goals achievement.
* Facilitates alignment and effective AWS communication within account team and internal/external key partners/customers and promptly resolves any conflict to encourage harmonious and productive interaction.
* Facilitates individual growth and development of account management, setting objectives, performance standards and priorities, coaching and acting as role model.
* Ensures disciplined methodology application across management groups, resulting in consistent and accurately forecasted results.
* Languages: English required.


**About The Team**
 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 Amazon values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Mentorship and Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
 The Ideal Candidate will:
   

  

* Have experience in providing strategic and or complex solutions and will be customer facing.


**Have The Ability To**
* Formulate, set, and manage strategy with account team to accelerate the cycle
* Confirm key decision makers and their decision making process and engage with customer to evaluate business issues and requirements
* Identify key levers to create compelling event assist closure
* Advise and construct optimal commercial structure addressing competition and customer requests and business outcomes.
* Formulate competitive financial models (e.g., cash flow, NPV, deal comparisons, etc.) to use as comparative tools to grow opportunity


**Preferred Qualifications**
 Understanding of cloud computing concepts and the AWS offering.
   

  

* Supports the development of solid references.
* Successful track record of driving adoption of new and disruptive technologies
* Has a strong understanding and experience working with entities within Public Sector and other European countries too
* Understand regulations, public policies, compliance, rules of engagement and ways of doing business in Public Sector, Public Tender processes work


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch) - G54
   

  

 Job ID: A2717038

title: Group Business Controller
description:
Gazella is now recruiting a business-driven, analytical, and communicative Group Business Controller for Karo Healthcare. As Group Business Controller, you will hold a senior position and be responsible for reporting, analyzing, and improving the business, identifying opportunities for optimization, and supporting strategic decision-making through data-driven insights.
 



  





 You will be part of a global Business Control team and report to the Head of Business Control. This role requires a deep understanding of business operations, advanced analytical skills, and the ability to communicate effectively with stakeholders across the organization. You will be a visible and influential resource within the organization, acting as a business partner to stakeholders, board members, and investors.
 



  





 You will be located at the HQ in central Stockholm, Norrmalm, with the opportunity to work in a hybrid model. This position may require occasional travel to different business units or client locations. Furthermore, it is important that you are fluent in English and possess strong communication skills.
 



  





**What Karo Healthcare offers you** 




 Karo Healthcare is on a journey of creation and development, with great ambition to expand the business substantially in the coming years. You will have the opportunity to be part of a very positive work environment with the possibility of a hybrid work model. You will be working with an energetic and motivated team that has a start-up mentality, all while being part of a larger international organization with strong values.
 



  





 As part of the Business Controlling team, you will be a visible and influential resource within the organization and have the opportunity to grow. Want to be part of this journey? Keep reading!
 



  





**Responsibilities** 




  




* Ensure timely and accurate financial reporting to Karo’s owners and Group Management
* Prepare consolidated financial statements for the group
* Develop and maintain key performance indicators (KPIs) and dashboards for senior management
* Analyze large sets of data to identify trends, patterns, and insights
* Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to track key performance indicators (KPIs)
* Use advanced analytical techniques and tools (e.g., predictive modeling, machine learning) to support business decision-making
* Communicate financial results and strategies to stakeholders, including senior management, board members, and investors



  





**Experience** 




 To succeed in this role, we expect you to have a university degree in Business Administration, Finance, or Computer Science, along with a minimum of 3-5 years of relevant experience in business analysis or business control. We also expect that you are accustomed to transforming large amounts of complex data into useful information that adds value to the business. You should be familiar with financial systems and BI tools, with excellent skills in Excel.
 



  





 Experience with SQL, R, and Python is an advantage but not a requirement. Your previous work should have required strong analytical skills, the ability to turn analysis into actionable insights, and the ability to collaborate and communicate cross-departmentally to drive actions. You should have a clear focus on improving processes and results, with a strong commercial orientation. It is also important that you can manage multiple priorities and work effectively under pressure. Finally, you must have excellent communication skills and be fluent in English.
 



  





**Personal Qualities** 




 To be a suitable candidate for this position, we believe you are a proactive person with a “can-do” attitude who enjoys working in a fast-paced business environment. You are open to asking for support whenever needed, not afraid to reach out within the organization, and you demonstrate a high level of integrity and accountability. You pay attention to detail and can work both hands-on and strategically, with the ability to align financial management with the strategic goals of the business. Furthermore, you are an influential communicator with the ability to clearly convey complex information to various stakeholders. As Karo believes in active teamwork, you see yourself as an excellent colleague and team player.
 



  





**About Karo Healthcare** 




 Karo Healthcare delivers smart choices for everyday healthcare. They own and commercialize branded, original over-the-counter products and prescription medicines across a range of everyday categories, including intimate health, skin health, digestive health, foot health, pain, cough and cold, wellness, and specialty products. Their products are available in more than 90 countries and are sold through pharmacies, retailers, and healthcare providers. Karo has its own sales organization in more than 10 European countries, with the Nordic region as its core market. Karo Healthcare is headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden, and has been owned by EQT Partners since 2019. Read more about Karo Healthcare at: karohealthcare.com
 



  





**Application** 




 Is this you? Apply using the ”ansök”-button! In this recruitment process Karo Healthcare is working together with Gazella. If you have any questions, you are welcome to contact Sophie Falk, sophie.falk@gazella.se, who is the responsible Recruitment Consultant for this position.

title: Territory Manager (m/f/d)
description:
Are you motivated to surpass sales targets, enthusiastic about cultivating impactful customer relationships, and eager to contribute to making people’s lives healthier, safer and more fulfilling? Then join us at Olympus Sweden and be part of an organization with a rich history and a significant market share in the field of endoscopy.
 



  





**Who are we looking for** 




  





 One of our Territory Managers has been recently promoted, which is why we're currently in search of a dependable and achievement-oriented professional to become his successor. Specifically, we're seeking a Territory Manager to join our EndoTherapy business unit within Gastrointestinal Endoscopy. You will be responsible for overseeing the southern region of Stockholm and nearby areas.
 



  





 As a Territory Manager at Olympus, you'll play a crucial role in achieving our sales targets. Your duties will involve actively nurturing client relationships, strategically driving sales for the products within your team and maintaining and expanding our market presence in Sweden. If you're enthusiastic about making a meaningful impact through sales excellence, we encourage you to read further.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 




  





 Territory business planning:
 


* Analyzing territory, segmenting targets, account planning



 Action planning:
 


* Monitoring sales results & establish correcting actions
* Tenders & after sales products
* Opportunity Management & pipeline control
* Continuous market & competitor monitoring



 Ensuring customer progressions along the ISP:
 


* Utilize progression model
* Train customers in products
* Comply with price policies
* Reporting (CRM & other reporting tools)



  





**Qualifications** 




  




* +2 years in a similar field sales role or nursing background is essential
* Sales experience within the healthcare industry is desirable
* Documented track record in handling technical complex sales projects
* Outstanding oral and written communication skills in both Swedish and English
* Exemplifies unwavering integrity in interactions with both external and internal stakeholders
* Exceptional organizational and planning abilities, adept at managing multiple demands and priorities effectively
* Committed to personal continuous improvement and development, maintaining a keen focus on growth and enhancement
* Innately self-motivated with a resolute determination to achieve success
* A strong commitment to diversity and inclusion, with the ability to contribute to a culture of Olympus



  





 We encourage you to apply, even if you do not tick all the boxes!
 



  





**Meet the team** 




  





 The successful candidate will collaborate closely with 3 other Territory Managers from the same business unit and engage in regular communication with our Swedish customer support counterparts. Joining a dynamic and experienced department, the individuals will experience a collaborative environment where team members actively support one another. At Olympus we work as a team, which means that we work close to other business units as well. One thing that makes Olympus so strong is that we have a “ONE-MEG” approach.
 



  





**Benefits and Perks** 




  




* Competitive base salary + monthly bonus
* Company provided pension + health insurance
* Company car, IT equipment for both office & home setup
* Structured Performance reviews and development opportunities
* Sport and culture benefits
* Diverse company events



  





 We're actively reviewing applications and encourage you to apply if this opportunity fits your career goals. Our talent team will assess your submission and reach out as needed.
 



  





**About Olympus Sweden** 




  





 Olympus Sweden is a key player within the Olympus EMEA region. With a dedicated team of over 60 professionals, we are committed to revolutionizing the field of medical procedures. Our primary focus is to collaborate with both public and private healthcare customers in Sweden, ensuring that cutting-edge advancements are seamlessly integrated into the healthcare system. With a shared vision, we strive to enhance patient care and contribute to the overall advancement of medical technology in the country.

title: Kundcenterhandläggare
description:
**Om arbetsplatsen**
 Lidingö stads kundcenter fick fina resultat i servicemätningar från SKR. Servicemätningen är en nulägesmätning som visar hur invånarna upplever kommunens bemötande, tydlighet och enkelhet via telefon eller e-post. Vill du vara en del av vårt fina team, ha roligt på jobbet och leverera kundservice i högsta klass? Vi söker nu två nya kundcenterhandläggare och kollegor.
   

  

 Vi tillhör stadsledningskontoret som är en av våra sex förvaltningar i Lidingö stad. Hos oss arbetar cirka 120 medarbetare. Vi fungerar som bron mellan politik, förvaltning och stadens olika verksamheter. Dagligen hjälper vi våra kollegor med råd, stöd och service inom hr, ekonomi, upphandling, kommunikation, registratur, juridik och it. Här samlas stor kompetens och många yrkeskategorier vilket ger en dynamisk arbetsmiljömed mycket utbyte och lärande.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
 En handläggare till Svarsgrupp för omsorg- och socialförvaltningen och lärande och kulturförvaltningen:
   

  

 Som kundcenterhandläggare i den här gruppen har du din hemvist i den svarsgrupp som tar emot frågor och mejl/ärenden kopplat till omsorg och socialförvaltningen. Det är många frågor om hemtjänst, färdtjänst, riksfärdtjänst, avgifter, faderskap, försörjning och övriga omsorgsfrågor och handläggning av ärenden på förvaltningen. I ditt ansvar ingår det att lära dig göra färdtjänstutredningar, riksfärdtjänst samt enkla faderskapsutredningar. Du kommer också att handlägga ärenden som rör lärande och kulturförvaltningen. Där är det många frågor om skola, förskola, köplatser, skolval, taxor med mera.
   

  

 En handläggare till Svarsgrupp för tekniska förvaltningen och miljö- och stadsbyggnadskontoret:
   

  

 Som kundcenterhandläggare i den här gruppen har du din hemvist i den svarsgrupp som tar emot frågor och mejl/ärenden kopplat till tekniska förvaltningens ansvarsområde. Det rör Lidingös yttre miljö och kan handla om gator, park och natur, snö, sand, belysning, avfall och mycket mer. Du kommer också vid behov att hantera ärenden kopplat till miljö- och stadsbyggnadskontorets ansvarsområde. Det handlar mycket om bygglovsrelaterade frågor, plan och exploatering samt att lämna ut allmän handling på begäran (ritningar, kartor med mer) men även om frågor kring miljö och näringsliv.
   

  

 Dina arbetsuppgifter består generellt i att arbeta schemalagt med att svara på alla inkommande samtal från medborgare och där målet är att i första kontakt kunna lämna information och lösa så många frågor och ärenden som möjligt. Dator och telefon är dina arbetsverktyg. En viktig arbetsuppgift är att kommunicera och samarbeta med kollegorna på förvaltningen. Det ingår även en del administrativa arbetsuppgifter inom området samt användning av Office och flera olika verksamhetssystem.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
 För tjänsten som kundcenterhandläggare letar vi efter dig som har tidigare erfarenhet av arbete inom kundtjänst med stor vana av telefon och dator som främsta arbetsverktyg. Det är en fördel om du tidigare har arbetat i kommunal sektor med liknande arbetsuppgifter. För dessa tjänster behöver du ha en lämplig avslutad gymnasial utbildning och om du dessutom har vidareutbildning eller tidigare erfarenheter kopplade till de specifika verksamhetsområdena är det meriterande.
   

  

 Tjänsten kräver mycket god:
   

  

* vana vid att möta kunder i telefon
* datorvana
* kunskaper i användandet av olika arbetsverktyg som Officepaketet, ärendehanteringssystem och gärna journalsystem
* att du effektivt kan söka/hitta information på webben internt och externt.


 Du ska kunna möta människor både i telefon och i verkliga livet samt vara van att hantera människor med olika behov. Det är av största vikt att du brinner för kundrelaterade frågor, att du är lösningsfokuserad och flexibel och att du vill ge bästa möjliga service och bemötande till de som tar kontakt med oss. Arbetet i kundcenter förutsätter god förmåga att uttrycka sig väl i tal och skrift både på svenska och på engelska. Vi arbetar utifrån värdeorden engagerad, professionell och initiativrik. De ger oss vägledning i hur vi vill uppfattas och agera för att ge god service och det bästa stödet till Lidingöborna.
   

  

**Övrig information**
 Staden tillämpar individuell lönesättning. Intervjuer kommer att ske löpande. Tillträde enligt överenskommelse och provanställning kan komma att tillämpas.
   

  

 I tjänsten ingår ett kvällspass var femte vecka till klockan 18:00. Vi erbjuder möjlighet till arbete på distans upp till 2 dagar i veckan efter upplärningsperioden.
   

  

 Välkommen till Lidingö stad! Här kan du njuta av närheten till natur & skärgård med endast 15minuters avstånd till T-centralen. Vi vill vara en attraktiv arbetsgivare som erbjuder utvecklingsmöjligheter. Vi vill ständigt förbättras och strävar efter att vara en lärande organisation i framkant. Om du delar vår passion för utvecklande ledarskap, ett aktivt medarbetarskap och en inkluderande arbetsplats är det till oss du ska söka för att bli en del av oss i Lidingö stad! Tillsammans kan vi skapa en meningsfull och berikande arbetsmiljö där vi kan växa och göra skillnad tillsammans.
   

  

 Lidingö stad arbetar med kompetensbaserad rekrytering så att varje person bedöms utifrån sin kompetens och att vi motverkar diskriminering.
   

  

 Inför rekryteringsarbetet har Lidingö stad tagit ställning till rekryteringskanaler och marknadsföring. Vi undanber oss därför kontakt med mediesäljare, rekryteringssajter och liknande.

title: xMBA (remote) for aspiring Product Managers, Business Developers, Sales Managers, Digital Marketers
description:
